name: palm date production, organic | palm date, organic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15590/documentation

This dataset represent the production of 1 kg of palm dates (fresh matter). The yield is  7281kg/ha.The average of palm trees per hectare is 100 (thus we count 72.81 kg of palm dates per tree). The lifetime of a palm tree is estimated at 80 years, during which the first 5 years the palm tree grows but does not produce fruit. This data takes into account these 5 first years. The organic production of palm date precludes the use of pesticides and funigides. The production of palm date are mainly manual and does not require machineries.

This activity starts when planting palm trees in the field.The production of the cutting is not considered. All processes of the agricultural production are included, such as the ressources used for the fruit growth. 

The dataset includs all the operations for the production of the fruits during one year. It includes Soil cultivation, harvesting, irrigating. This activity ends when the fruit is harvested and transported to a storage facility (10 km from the field).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0122:Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The yield data have been collected for the year 2012
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is an extrapolation that refers to an average production in south Tunisia - Chott Djerid  - Tozeur
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is an original dataset  specific to the production of palm date in the south of Tunisia (Region of Chott-Djerid)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were compiled from informations provided by farmers in the region of Tozeur, Tunisia. The datas were verified and adjusted by experts in palm date. The yield of the organic production has been defined by the General Direction of Organic Agricultre (Tunisia).   As the production of palm date occurs in an arid regions, no emission to water are included (leaching of NO3, PO4, heavy metals , soil erosion, etc. ).

flow.name: palm date, organic
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0122:Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits

exchanges.description: In order to replace chemical pesticide and fungicides for the organic production, a mixture of 80% sulfure is used in the field. We count 300g per palm tree each year

flow.name: sulfur
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/191:Manufacture of coke oven products/1910:Manufacture of coke oven products

defaultProvider.name: market for sulfur | sulfur | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: B:Mining and quarrying/06:Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas/062:Extraction of natural gas/0620:Extraction of natural gas

exchanges.description:
The water is drawn form two aquifers, the total amount is estimated to 225 m3 per tree per year. 
In order to irrigate the field, a pump was set up by the tunisan governement. Each farmer has to pay for the electric consumption of the pump.
Irrigation in the field is a surface irrigation, water is pumped from the water table and is carried in the palm by irrigation canals. Besides the hydraulic pump, irrigation is not mechanized (no sprinkler system).
The hydraulic system is then the irrigation pipelines and irrigation rooms in cement. The cement is used for the construction of water chambers to irriguate the plam treses. There is about 24 chambers for 1 ha. With a density of 2162 kg/m3 for the cement and a volume of 0.314 m3 for one room, we assume that each rooms weighs 675 kg. Also we assume that the lifetime of the cement in those conditions is about 15 years.

flow.name: irrigation
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

exchanges.description: When modelling water use (irrigation) during agricultural production the default assumption is, that 80% of water used for irrigation is released to the ground (groundwater) and 20% to surface water bodies.

exchanges.description: The palm dates are collected and the tillage is made with a tractor. This engine is not used really often, and for only small distance.But as it is the only machinery used inside the field it seems important to modelise it.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of palm date, organic is calculated to be circa 4.12E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'sulfur'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 8.24E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

flow.name: packaging, for pesticides
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

defaultProvider.category: C:Manufacturing/22:Manufacture of rubber and plastics products/222:Manufacture of plastics products/2220:Manufacture of plastics products

exchanges.description: The dry matter content is 0.79114, the C content on a dry matter basis 0.251, 0.79114*0.251=0.1986 kg C/kg dates harvested. This value has to be multiplied by the yield and converted to CO2: 0.1986*44/12=6177.3 kg CO2. This amount of CO2 is taken up from the air and converted to the product.

exchanges.description: The field is located in the south of tunisia - Near the desert. The crop is then irrigated regularly to fullfill the need of the palm trees.  Values calculated from a crop of 1 ha  based in tunisia with a mean yield of 7281 kg/ha every year. The lifetime of the crop is 80 years, knowing that dates are produced only 75 years
